segments.text: I see the water overflowing, and I feel a little sick just looking at it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is standing in it, and she doesn’t even seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the kids climbing and sneaking, and it’s just too much.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is on that stool, and it looks like it’s about to tip over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for a cookie like it’s no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the whole kitchen is going to be ruined if this keeps up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so nice, but inside, it’s just a disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder why the woman isn’t paying attention to any of this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should look away, but I can’t.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is just one of those moments where everything feels wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR
